intent_atoms.description: The annotation and bookmark data must be persisted reliably across instances of the FileBackedAnnotationBookmarkStore.
As a user, I want annotations and bookmarks to be stored in a file-backed JSON store so that they persist between app launches.

Given the FileBackedAnnotationBookmarkStore is initialized, when an annotation or bookmark is created/updated/deleted, then the changes are written to the JSON file and subsequent instances read the same data.
Use a JSON-backed FileBackedAnnotationBookmarkStore for persistence instead of CoreData until the research gap R6 lands.
As a developer, I want the store to be migrated to CoreData once the research gap is resolved so that we can use the final storage layer.
Once the core data migration plan is defined and applied, the store should read/write data using CoreData and integrate with SwiftUI view models.

functional_units.name: File-backed Annotation Bookmark Store
functional_units.description: Provides persistence for annotations and bookmarks using a JSON file store, supporting create, update, delete, and bookmark flows.

functional_units.name: Annotation Bookmark Persistence Tests
functional_units.description: Unit tests that verify the correctness of annotation and bookmark creation, updating, deletion, and persistence across multiple store instances.
